definition: sticky/glutinous/(Tw) to adhere/to stick on/to glue
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]

sentences.english: Then by heat treatment the fine particles are agglomerated into a cohesive , useful product.
sentences.chinese: 这些细颗粒经热处理后可以凝结成为黏合的有用制品。

sentences.english: It can be difficult to get a group of people to cohere.
sentences.chinese: 你把一团雪捏紧，雪就黏合成雪球。

sentences.english: Water-honeyed pills are made of fine powder of crude drugs, using honey and water as binders.
sentences.chinese: 水蜜丸系指药材细粉以蜂蜜和水为黏合剂制成的丸剂。

sentences.english: The coagulum power of multi - race nation serves as the adhesion of Singapore economy modernization.
sentences.chinese: 多民族国家的凝聚力是现代化的黏合剂。

sentences.english: Flexible epoxy bonding or soft adhesive bonding is preferred to the packaging process.
sentences.chinese: 在包装过程中最好使用柔性环氧黏合或软黏胶性结合。

sentences.english: For women, conversation is the glue that holds relationships together.
sentences.chinese: 对女性来说，谈话是保持关系的黏合剂。

sentences.english: Use this glue to bond the two materials.
sentences.chinese: 用这胶水黏合这两种材料。

sentences.english: Strips of wood are bonded together and moulded by machine.
sentences.chinese: 木板条被黏合在一起并用机器压模成型。

sentences.english: They were glued by Elmer this time.
sentences.chinese: 这件作品都是用白胶浆黏合的。

sentences.english: We bond the pieces of the model airplane with glue.
sentences.chinese: 我们用胶水把模型飞机的碎片黏合到一起。

sentences.english: Fold the focusing bars as shown, no adhesive needed.
sentences.chinese: 依折线将对焦棒折曲，不需黏合。

sentences.english: This drug lowers cholesterol levels by binding fats in the intestine.
sentences.chinese: 这种药通过黏合肠内的脂肪降低胆固醇水平。

sentences.english: The two materials will bond if you heat them.
sentences.chinese: 如果你加热两种材料，它们会黏合起来。

sentences.english: Can you glue the broken mirror?
sentences.chinese: 你能把这个破镜黏合吗？。

definition: to glue/to paste/to adhere/to stick to
to cast off (in knitting)/to sew a finishing hem/to close up (of wound)/to heal
to form a seam/to join up
